Title: "Country Cousin" Sodbuster—Amber
Body (HTML):
The classic sodbuster pocket knife pattern has been popular for generations as a simple, tough, no-frills working knife. This one, made in Titusville, Pennsylvania, exemplifies all of the pattern's best qualities, which is what you would expect from Queen Cutlery, one of the oldest knife companies still manufacturing in the US.

The blade is made from Queen's famously durable D2 carbon steel, which will take a very long-lasting edge. The scales are made from genuine DuPont Delrin. The knife is available in the two traditional colors: yellow and black.

  • Made in the USA (Titusville, PA)

Title: Classic Duffel—Brite Red
Body (HTML):
The humble duffel remains the most versatile sort of bag you can buy. It is unsurpassed for utility and is equally capable whether you're using it as luggage on a long weekend trip or taking a change of clothes to the gym. I've got one that goes with me when I travel and one that serves as a sailing bag. This duffel bag is durably constructed and will not let you down.

Construction

  • stout #8 vat-dyed cotton duck (18 oz/yd) construction
  • heavyweight military-spec webbing completely encompasses the bag
  • rolled handles
  • super-smooth heavy gauge nylon YKK zipper
  • #138 polyester bonded thread
  • 22" long by 11" diameter
  • Made in the USA (Arundel, ME)

Title: Crew-neck Wool Sweater—Dark Sheep's Gray
Body (HTML):
You will not find another sweater like this one. The secret is in the wool--it is knit from mule-spun yarn from one of the last American mills using this 18th-century process. Mule-spun yarn (so called because it is spun on a machine called a spinning mule, which mimics the actions of hand-spinning), has a softer twist and more loft than other yarns, and the finished product shares these characteristics with classic woolens like those used in Harris tweed.

Construction

  • two-ply mule-spun sport-weight yarn
  • traditional double rib rounded neckline
  • set in sleeves
  • ribbed cuffs and hem
  • Made in the USA

Sizing


 shoulder to shoulder (back) pit to pit (front) shoulder to cuff center back
small 18" 20" 22" 26.5"
medium 20" 21" 21.5" 26.5"
large 21.5" 22.75" 22" 27"

Title: Fisher Stripe Barn Coat
Body (HTML):
This barn coat comes from the storied Pointer Brand's "Special Make" line, a line of small production runs inspired by the company's customers. In this case they've taken their classic blanket-lined barn coat and made up a few in fisher-stripe (herringbone) denim. But if the fabric is unique, the bulletproof construction is classic Pointer. The denim shell will keep out the wind and the warm wool-blend blanket lining will keep you warm.

Construction

  • 100% cotton denim exterior
  • warm blue wool-blend blanket lining
  • pre-washed to stabilize sizing
  • corduroy collar and cuff linings
  • four patch pockets (one with button flap)
  • button cuffs
  • nickel-plated brass buttons
  • Made in the USA (Bristol, TN)

Sizing


 shoulder to shoulder (back) pit to pit (front) shoulder to cuff center back
small 19" 20.75" 25.25" 28.75"
medium 20.5" 22.5" 25.5" 30.25"
large 21" 25" 27.5" 31"

Title: Outpost Throw—Iron
Body (HTML):
A throw should be warm, soft, and versatile, and this one is all of those things. Take it anywhere—camping, in the car, or just around the house. The soft, light, and highly-insulating pure merino wool will keep you warm and won't wear out, and the red contrast whip-stitched edges keep it interesting.

Construction

  • 100% fine merino wool
  • contrast whip-stitching on all edges
  • machine wash and dry
  • 60" x 50"
  • Made in the USA (Faribault, MN)

Title: Ronsir Sunglasses
Body (HTML):
The Shuron Ronsir, developed in 1947, was the very first combination frame (a frame featuring plastic top and temples with metal rims), and it is still made today in the US by Shuron. to the same high standard. There are a number of imitations of these frames at the moment—but there's no reason not to get the real thing.

Construction

  • barrel hinges
  • high-quality polarized gray-green (G15) sunglass lenses
  • 48mm size
  • Made in the USA (South Carolina)

Title: Sidewinder Sunglasses—Black Fade
Body (HTML):
The Sidewinder is another classically American frame from Shuron, constructed to the company's usual high standard. We've had these made up with high-quality polarized G15 lenses which we feel suit the frame very well.

Construction

  • barrel hinges
  • high-quality polarized gray-green (G15) sunglass lenses
  • 48mm size
  • Made in the USA (South Carolina)

Title: Trapper Scarf—Navy & White
Body (HTML):
This classic tri-stripe scarf from Faribault Woolen Mill is made from dense, soft-loomed wool.

The Faribault Woolen Mill in Faribault, Minnesota, opened in 1865 and closed in 2009. But unlike so many other shuttered factories across the midwest, the mill reopened in 2011 after its purchase by a local family. These scarves are produced in the same facility, on the same equipment, and by some of the same employees as the original Faribault Woolen Mill which at one time made more than half of the wool blankets sold in the US.

Construction

  • 100% soft-loomed wool
  • 10" x 72"
  • Made in the USA (Faribault, MN)

Title: Two-Blade Congress
Body (HTML):
This very solid knife from Queen Cutlery's limited edition Queen City line is a recreation of a design from the company's archives, made with traditional construction and materials in Titusville, Pennsylvania. It makes an excellent everyday knife. The Congress pocketknife pattern is a handy and versatile pattern for an everyday knife (at the Library of Congress they've got the one Abraham Lincoln was carrying when he was assassinated). And Queen's construction is top-notch.

  • easily-sharpened carbon steel blades
  • 2 1/2" Wharncliffe blade (one of my favorite blades, tremendously handy)
  • 2 1/4" pen-knife blade
  • 4" overall
  • brass liners
  • nickel silver bolsters
  • genuine bone scales
  • Made in the USA (Titusville, PA)

Title: Wool Jacket—Green Buffalo Plaid
Body (HTML):
This wonderful unlined jacket is available in traditional red or green buffalo plaid and is perfect for keeping you warm when you need a little more freedom of movement than a heavy winter coat can provide. It has thoughtful details that competitors' more-expensive jackets lack, like canvas linings on the inside cuffs so that the wool doesn't irritate your wrists (although this is a very nice soft virgin wool, not too scratchy at all). I don't believe you'll find a better-made or better-designed example of this style of jacket anywhere, and at this price it is an exceptional value.

Construction

  • Woolrich 85% virgin wool/15% nylon fabric
  • Leather Labonville logo patch over right chest pocket
  • Second layer of wool over shoulders and upper chest for additional protection from the cold and the damp
  • Two chest patch pockets with snap closure
  • Two deep hand-warmer welt pockets
  • Heavy-duty brass zipper
  • Canvas-lined cuffs with snap closure
  • Gunmetal snaps throughout
  • Made in the USA

Sizing


 shoulder to shoulder (back) pit to pit (front) shoulder to cuff center back (excluding collar)
small 18.5" 21" 22" 28"
medium 19" 22" 23" 28"
large 20" 24" 24.75" 29"
